alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Basin; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:09PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wasatch...west central Duchesne...south central Summit and eastern Utah Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 308 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Fruitland, or 25 miles southeast of Heber City, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tabiona, Fruitland, Strawberry Reservoir and Hanna. This includes the following highways... US Route 40 between mile markers 38 and 65. Utah Route 35 between mile markers 12 and 45. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 13 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Strawberry Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Basin; Western Uinta Mountains
